questions.question: If drivers are not required by law to wear seatbelts,

drivers will drive faster and less careful

questions.question: If a producer offers a price that is in excess of a consumer's valuation of the good, the consumer

choices.answer: must buy the good at that price
will refuse to purchase the good
must revalue the good
None of the above

questions.question: If, at a certain level of output (Q), the marginal benefit is less than the marginal cost, it will raise net benefit by

choices.answer: increasing Q
decreasing Q
staying at that level of Q
The net benefit does not depend on Q

questions.question: Which of the following is incorrect?

choices.answer: Accounting profits generally overstate economic profits
Accounting profits do not take opportunity cost into account

Managers should only be interested in accounting profits
